results.title: Kindred
results.brief_description:
A drama about incest based on a number of case studies. Penny tries to make her mother and younger sister face the reality of her situation as a victim of parental incest.
Written by Debra Oswald and starring Alyson Best and Russell Newman.

results.title: My Dreaming
results.brief_description: If you don’t know where you come from how do you know how to go forward? Look into the past, at women who have gone. Have their stories also gone with them?

results.title: The Girl who met Simone de Beauvoir in Paris
results.creator_credit: Richard Wherrett, Richard Brennan and AFTRS
results.brief_description: Regarded as one of Australia’s acclaimed theatre and artistic directors, Richard Wherrett has transformed his directing skills into film with this adaptation of “The Girl who met Simone de Beauvoir in Paris. Cast includes Tony Llewellyn-Jones, Judy Morris, Anna Volska and John Clayton. Director of Photography, Geoff Burton.

results.title: Love your Work
results.brief_description: When my son turned 15 I began to reflect on my Father’s life and his father before him. This story spans across continents and four generations of men.

results.title: Gary's story
results.creator_credit: Richard Michalak, Ray Argall, Rolf De Heer and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
Gary is between girlfriends. When he meets Sally in the supermarket he discovers that she is between boyfriends so he asks her out.
“What about a cup of coffee?”
“I don’t drink coffee.”
“Tea, then?”
“I don’t believe in stimulants.”
“Milk?”
“Creates mucus.”
From this high point their relationship deteriorates. But Gary’s story has a happy ending – eventually.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Richard Michalak, Ray Argall, Rolf De Heer and AFTRS

results.title: Sorry
results.brief_description: 75 years later, the survivors and their descendants of the Coniston massacre invited my family to remember the past. I went to say sorry. I was the only member of my family to attend.

results.title: Freely given
results.brief_description: “This instrument may be freely given, never bought or sold” says violin maker John Godschall Johnson as we see him carving and shaping a beautifully handcrafted violin into its final form.

results.title: Billie in Oakleigh
results.brief_description:
A short home-movie shot in slow-motion of the graceful and elegant movements of Billie O’Keefe as she performs a gymnastic routine in the urban landscape of Oxford Street, Oakleigh.
This poetic film is backed by the haunting soundtrack of celtic music played by Cath Connelly (harp) and Greg Hunt (fiddle).
